title: The Freedom of Unpredictability

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I'm free, in the sense that I cannot predict reliably my actions. Also, if you think I'm confined by my feelings, they can change too.
dialogue.context: Responding to Architect's judgments about his intentions

scene_context: After being challenged about his intentions and possible selfishness, Evan claims a form of freedom through his own unpredictability - a philosophical stance that intrigues the Architect.
narrator_note: PHILOSOPHER: Unpredictability as liberationâ€”a startling claim. If feelings shift like weather, perhaps the prison of patterns has windows after all.
